document_data.name: Abacus
document_data.mainbody: '''Abacuses''' were a type of tool for performing [[mathematics|mathematical]] calculations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. It was not possible to perform complex equations upon them.
document_data.Description: An abacus consisted of a rectangular, wooden frame that typically measured around {{SI|8|in|long=yes}} by {{SI|10|in|long=yes}} across. Inside these frames were several heavy wires, tightly strung parallel to one another. Strung on each of these wires were typically ten wooden balls. By manipulating these balls, a user could perform simple mathematical operations.
document_data.Notable Abacuses:
* ''[[Abacus of calculation]]''
* ''[[Occultant abacus]]'', a variety of magical abacus whose beads resembled little skulls and that had the power to alter the probability of those around the wielder.

[[File:Digitalogist.jpg|thumb|''A digitalogist carefully calculates a [[spell]] on an abacus.'']]

Notable Users of Abacuses.Classes:
* [[Artificer]]s often owned an abacus.
* [[Digitalogist]]s often used abacuses.
* [[Occultant]]s, a variety of adventuring accountants that were named for their use of a magical item known as the ''occultant abacus''.
Notable Users of Abacuses.Groups: * Abacuses were a commonly used item among many sages throughout the Realms.
Notable Users of Abacuses.Individuals:
* [[Medar Klun]]
* [[Mirt the Moneylender]] was quite adept at using abbesses to calculate money, loans, and loan interests.
Notable Users of Abacuses.Nations: * In the empire of [[Shou Lung]], abacuses were a commonly used accounting tool.
